parameters.text:
=Analyze this CV and extract the following information in JSON format:

{
"file Name":"file name",
  "name": "full name",
  "email": "email address",
  "phone": "phone number (replace + with 00 and return only digits",
  "skills": "comma-separated skills",
  "experienceYears": "number of years",
  "education": "highest education",
  "jobTitles": "previous job titles comma-separated",
  "summary": "brief 2-3 sentence summary"
}
file name 
:{{ $('Loop Over Files1').item.json.name }}
CV Text:
{{ $json.text }}

Respond with ONLY the JSON object, no other text.

options.systemMessage: Analyze the CV and extract the following information. Respond with ONLY a valid JSON object:

parameters.inputSchema:
{
"file Name":"file name",
  "name": "full name",
  "email": "email address",
  "phone": "phone number",
  "skills": "comma-separated skills",
  "experienceYears": "number of years",
  "education": "highest education",
  "jobTitles": "previous job titles comma-separated",
  "summary": "brief 2-3 sentence summary"
}

folderId.cachedResultName: CV Screening & Interview Scheduler with Loops

parameters.content:
## Create or Find Sheet
1. Search for the Google Sheet by name.
2. If it exists:
   - Return its `sheet_id`.
3. If it does **not** exist:
   - Create a new sheet.
   - Return its `sheet_id`.
4. Pass the `sheet_id` downstream (e.g. store it in a variable) so later nodes (e.g. â€œSave to Google Sheetsâ€) can use it for writing.
## Check if the file is empty. If yes, process the first CV. If not, check if the file name exists in the sheet. If it does, continue the loop; otherwise, process the file.

parameters.prompt:
=Job Title: {{ $('Webhook - Search Candidates').item.json.query['Job position'] }}

All Candidates:

{{ $json.data.toJsonString() }}
Rank the TOP 20 candidates for this position based on:
1. Relevant skills match
2. Years of experience
3. Previous job titles relevance
4. Education background

Return a JSON array with exactly 5 candidates:
[
  {
    "rank": 1,
    "name": "candidate name",
    "email": "email",
    "phone": "phone",
    "matchScore": 95,
    "reason": "brief reason for ranking"
  }
]

Respond with ONLY the JSON array, no other text.

Candidates:

parameters.content:
##  webex 
ðŸ›  Steps you can try right now

Hereâ€™s a checklist to resolve it:

Review / limit scopes

Change your OAuth credentials in the meeting service dev console, ensure only valid scopes are enabled.

In n8n, only request those scopes (donâ€™t add extra ones).

Set correct callback / redirect URI

In your meeting serviceâ€™s app settings, set the redirect URI exactly to https://yourâ€‘n8n-domain.com/rest/oauth2-credential/callback

Make sure the protocol (https / http), subdomain, path, and trailing slash match exactly.

Set WEBHOOK_URL in n8n

For selfâ€‘hosted n8n, in your environment or docker config, set something like:

WEBHOOK_URL=https://yourâ€‘n8n-domain.com/


Restart n8n after that.

Test in incognito / fresh session

Clear cache / cookies, then try the OAuth flow again to ensure thereâ€™s no stale state.

Upgrade n8n / check for patches

If youâ€™re on an older version, upgrade to the latest stable; there have been fixes to OAuth2 issues.

Also check n8nâ€™s GitHub issues to see if your specific meeting integration has known OAuth bugs.

Check logs

Look at n8n logs (server console) when the callback fails. There may be more detailed error messages.

parameters.query:
WITH cte AS (
  SELECT session_id
  FROM "cv_screening_and_nterview_scheduler"
  GROUP BY session_id
  HAVING COUNT(*) > 5000
)
DELETE FROM "cv_screening_and_nterview_scheduler"
WHERE session_id IN (SELECT session_id FROM cte)
AND ctid IN (
  SELECT ctid
  FROM "cv_screening_and_nterview_scheduler"
  WHERE session_id IN (SELECT session_id FROM cte)
  ORDER BY ctid
  LIMIT (SELECT COUNT(*) - 5000 FROM "cv_screening_and_nterview_scheduler" WHERE session_id IN (SELECT session_id FROM cte))
);

nodes.name: Execute a SQL query
nodes.notes: This process ensures that each session_id in the CV_Screening_and_nterview_Scheduler table maintains a maximum of 5,000 rows. Once a session_id exceeds this limit, the oldest records are automatically deleted to maintain optimal database performance.
